panels.description:
Traffic monitoring of a server and related entities like vNIC/vHBA, backplane ports, etc.
 -  Search a *Service Profile* from the drop-down menu at the top of the page.
 -  Use the *UCS Domain* drop down menu to limit the scope to a specific UCS domain or select *All* to search from all the available service profiles.
Displayed color (Green or Orange) based on the operational state of the service profile

targets.query: SELECT last("oper_state_code") FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
select domain_name as "Name" from (select domain_name,last(bytes_rx_delta) from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select domain as "Domain" from (select domain,last(admin_state) from "$db"."$rp"."Servers" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select location as "Location" from (select location,last(admin_state) from "$db"."$rp"."Servers" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
SELECT last("oper_state") as "Oper State" FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
SELECT last("operability") as "Operability" FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
SELECT last("association") as "Associate" FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
SELECT last("model") as "Model" FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter
SELECT last("serial") as "Serial" FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter

targets.query: select chassis from (select chassis,last(bytes_rx_delta) from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select id from (select id,last(admin_state) from "$db"."$rp"."Servers" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select sum(last) as num_cpu from (SELECT last("num_cpus") FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)
select sum(last) as num_cores from (SELECT last("num_cores") FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)
select sum(last) as memory from (SELECT last("memory") FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)
select sum(last) as num_veth from (SELECT last("num_vEths") FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)
select sum(last) as num_vfc from (SELECT last("num_vFCs") FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)
select sum(last) as num_adaptors from (SELECT last("num_adaptors") FROM "$db"."$rp"."Servers" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/) AND $timeFilter)

SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/((([[__to]] - [[__from]])/1000)/[[polling_interval]]) AS "RX Traffic" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY domain,chassis,service_profile fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/((([[__to]] - [[__from]])/1000)/[[polling_interval]]) AS "TX Traffic" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY domain,chassis,service_profile fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "RX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms),domain,service_profile fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "TX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms),domain,service_profile fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/((([[__to]] - [[__from]])/1000)/[[polling_interval]]) AS "RX Traffic" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY domain,chassis,service_profile fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/((([[__to]] - [[__from]])/1000)/[[polling_interval]]) AS "TX Traffic" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY domain,chassis,service_profile fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "RX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms),domain,service_profile fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]]/([[__interval_ms]]/([[polling_interval]] * 1000)) AS "TX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time([[__interval_ms]]ms),domain,service_profile fill(linear)

panels.description:
**Use Case**: Find traffic utilization per vNIC/vHBA on a server

![vIF utilization](/public/img/utm/vif_traffic.png)

**How to use**: Monitor TX and RX traffic rate over the selected time window

**Details**: If you are looking for % utilization, check - Backplane port % utilization per vIF

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  / [[polling_interval]]*8 AS "RX", mean("bytes_tx_delta")  / [[polling_interval]]*8 AS "TX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "vif_name" fill(linear)

panels.title: $vif on $service_profile

panels.description:

 - These graphs are not generated if your servers are directed to connected to the FI. In that case, the FI ports are still called Server Ports, not backplane Ports. Go to Domain Traffic dashboard to monitor FI Server Ports.

panels.description:
**Use Case**: Find errors and dropped packets

**How to use**: Errors and dropped packets are not good. It requires further investigation.

targets.query: SELECT sum("dropped_rx_delta") AS "RX Dropped", sum("dropped_tx_delta") AS "TX Dropped", sum("errors_rx_delta") AS "RX Errors", sum("errors_tx_delta") AS "TX Error" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "vif_name" fill(linear)

panels.title: $vif on $service_profile
vIF (vHBA and vNIC) errors and dropped packets on $service_profile

panels.description:
**Use Case**: Find traffic congestion on backplane ports (between IOM/FEX and server)
![Backplane port ingress congestion](/public/img/utm/backplane_port_rx_pause.png)

**How to use**: A (sustained) spike in PAUSE frame rate is a good indication of congestion. An increase in traffic rate at the same time is a very strong evidence of congestion and also signals that congestion is due to over-utilization.

**Details**: 
 - The graphs show PAUSE frame and traffic rate on backplane ports which connect blade servers and IOM within a UCS chassis.
 - PAUSE frames are sent by a traffic receiver when it is unable to receive the traffic at the incoming rate.
 - On a port, RX traffic should be compared againt TX PAUSE and vice-versa.
 - Focus on (sustained) spikes only because PAUSE frames may be exchanged under normal condition also.
 - PAUSE frames are not reported at a per vNIC/vHBA level.

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  / [[polling_interval]]*8 AS "RX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "peer_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "vif_name" fill(linear)

SELECT mean("bytes_tx_delta")  / [[polling_interval]]*8 AS "TX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("peer_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

SELECT last("speed")  *1000000000 AS "TX Util Max" FROM "$db"."$rp"."BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("peer_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

SELECT difference(mean("pause_rx"))  / [[polling_interval]] AS "RX PAUSE" FROM "$db"."$rp"."BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("peer_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

 - PAUSE frames are not reported at a per vNIC/vHBA level.

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_tx_delta")  / [[polling_interval]]*8 AS "TX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "peer_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "vif_name" fill(linear)

SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  / [[polling_interval]]*8 AS "RX" FROM "$db"."$rp"."BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("peer_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

SELECT mean("speed")  *1000000000 AS "Util Max" FROM "$db"."$rp"."BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("peer_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

SELECT difference(mean("pause_tx"))  / [[polling_interval]] AS "TX PAUSE" FROM "$db"."$rp"."BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("peer_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

panels.title: Server Egress Traffic Congestion - PAUSE frames vs traffic - Backplane port $bp_port with vHBA/vNIC breakdown

panels.description:
**Use Case**: Find traffic congestion on backplane ports (between IOM/FEX and server)
![Backplane port ingress congestion](/public/img/utm/backplane_port_rx_pause.png)

**How to use**: A (sustained) spike in PAUSE frame rate is a good indication of congestion. An increase in traffic rate at the same time is a very strong evidence of congestion and also signals that congestion is due to over-utilization.

**Details**: 
 - The graphs show PAUSE frame and traffic rate on backplane ports which connect blade servers and IOM within a UCS chassis.
 - PAUSE frames are sent by a traffic receiver when it is unable to receive the traffic at the incoming rate.
 - On a port, RX traffic should be compared againt TX PAUSE and vice-versa.
 - Focus on (sustained) spikes only because PAUSE frames may be exchanged under normal condition also.
 - PAUSE frames are not reported at a per vNIC/vHBA level.

SELECT last("speed")  *1000000000 AS "TX Util Max" FROM "$db"."$rp"."BackplanePortStats" WHERE ("peer_service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "bp_port" =~ /^$bp_port$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "bp_port" fill(linear)

Use ## for comments and # for configuration. ## The following names are reserved and should not be used (or ignored): ## id, tooltip, placeholder(s), link and label (see below) ## # ## Node label with placeholders and HTML. ## Default is '%name_of_first_column%'. # # label: %name%
%position%
Email # ## Node style (placeholders are replaced once). ## Default is the current style for nodes. # # style: label;image=%image%;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;rounded=1;fillColor=%fill%;strokeColor=%stroke%; # ## Parent style for nodes with child nodes (placeholders are replaced once). # # parentstyle: swimlane;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;childLayout=stackLayout;horizontal=1;horizontalStack=0;resizeParent=1;resizeLast=0;collapsible=1; # ## Optional column name that contains a reference to a named style in styles. ## Default is the current style for nodes. # # stylename: - # ## JSON for named styles of the form {"name": "style", "name": "style"} where style is a cell style with ## placeholders that are replaced once. # # styles: - # ## Optional column name that contains a reference to a named label in labels. ## Default is the current label. # # labelname: - # ## JSON for named labels of the form {"name": "label", "name": "label"} where label is a cell label with ## placeholders. # # labels: - # ## Uses the given column name as the identity for cells (updates existing cells). ## Default is no identity (empty value or -). # # identity: - # ## Uses the given column name as the parent reference for cells. Default is no parent (empty or -). ## The identity above is used for resolving the reference so it must be specified. # # parent: - # ## Adds a prefix to the identity of cells to make sure they do not collide with existing cells (whose ## IDs are numbers from 0..n, sometimes with a GUID prefix in the context of realtime collaboration). ## Default is csvimport-. # # namespace: csvimport- # ## Connections between rows ("from": source colum, "to": target column). ## Label, style and invert are optional. Defaults are '', current style and false. ## If placeholders are used in the style, they are replaced with data from the source. ## An optional placeholders can be set to target to use data from the target instead. ## In addition to label, an optional fromlabel and tolabel can be used to name the column ## that contains the text for the label in the edges source or target (invert ignored). ## The label is concatenated in the form fromlabel + label + tolabel if all are defined. ## The target column may contain a comma-separated list of values. ## Multiple connect entries are allowed. # # connect: {"from": "manager", "to": "name", "invert": true, "label": "manages", \ # "style": "curved=1;endArrow=blockThin;endFill=1;fontSize=11;"} # connect: {"from": "refs", "to": "id", "style": "curved=1;fontSize=11;"} # ## Node x-coordinate. Possible value is a column name. Default is empty. Layouts will ## override this value. # # left: # ## Node y-coordinate. Possible value is a column name. Default is empty. Layouts will ## override this value. # # top: # ## Node width. Possible value is a number (in px), auto or an @ sign followed by a column ## name that contains the value for the width. Default is auto. # # width: auto # ## Node height. Possible value is a number (in px), auto or an @ sign followed by a column ## name that contains the value for the height. Default is auto. # # height: auto # ## Padding for autosize. Default is 0. # # padding: -12 # ## Comma-separated list of ignored columns for metadata. (These can be ## used for connections and styles but will not be added as metadata.) # # ignore: id,image,fill,stroke,refs,manager # ## Column to be renamed to link attribute (used as link). # # link: url # ## Spacing between nodes. Default is 40. # # nodespacing: 40 # ## Spacing between levels of hierarchical layouts. Default is 100. # # levelspacing: 100 # ## Spacing between parallel edges. Default is 40. Use 0 to disable. # # edgespacing: 40 # ## Name or JSON of layout. Possible values are auto, none, verticaltree, horizontaltree, ## verticalflow, horizontalflow, organic, circle or a JSON string as used in Layout, Apply. ## Default is auto. # # layout: auto # ## ---- CSV below this line. targets.query: select last(service_profile) as "sp" from (select service_profile,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(vif_name) as "vif" from (select vif_name,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(chassis) as "chassis" from (select chassis,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND $timeFilter)

select last(iom_backplane_port) as "bp_port" from (select iom_backplane_port,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(fi_id) as "fi" from (select fi_id,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)

select last(pinned_uplink) as "pinned_uplink" from (select pinned_uplink,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(bound_veth) as "veth" from (select bound_veth,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)
select last(bound_vfc) as "vfc" from (select bound_vfc,bytes_rx_delta from "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" where "service_profile"  =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "vif_name" =~ /^$vif$/ AND $timeFilter)

targets.query: SELECT last("leadership") as "leadership" FROM "$db"."$rp"."FIEnvStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "fi_id" = 'B') AND $timeFilter

panels.description:
**Use Case**: Verify (uniform) traffic distribution over FI-A and FI-B.

**How to use**: Give a quick look to the graph on the left and the graph on the right. If they look similar, traffic distribution is uniform.

**Details**: Inbound and Outbound traffic over FI-A and FI-B is shown side-by-side with the granularity of traffic type (FC/Ethernet) and vNIC/vHBA.

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX Traffic" FROM "$db"."$rp"."VnicStats" WHERE ("service_profile" =~ /^$service_profile$/ AND "fi_id" = 'A' AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "vif_name", "service_profile" fill(linear)
